alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 5:57PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Johnson County through 630 PM CDT... At 556 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Tiffin, or 7 miles west of Iowa City, moving west at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 230 and 240. Interstate 380 near mile marker 1. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
